intro: Aegiphila paludosa, commonly known as marsh aegiphila, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in South America. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or along riverbanks. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color. Aegiphila paludosa plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
